notesStmt.note: Yeḥiel Naḥman Foa: inscribed, folio 1r.Censored by F. Luigi, Bernard[u]s Nucertus [...[ officii Parmae, and Joseph Carmini: inscribed, folio 456r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 8 leaves each. Original Hebrew folation, beginning with folio 10.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian cursive script of the 17th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown leather. Spine: 'Moses Cordovero. Pardes Rimmonim. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,138.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 245: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [457v] (fse001v).
